noun.description: A return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength.
examples: signs of recovery in the housing market
he's back at home now and he looks all set to make a full recovery

noun.description: The action or process of regaining possession or control of something stolen or lost.
examples: a team of salvage experts to ensure the recovery of family possessions

noun.description: The process of removing or extracting an energy source or industrial chemical for use, reuse, or waste treatment.

phrases: support groups for parents whose children are in recovery
He admitted the festive season can often lead to depression for those currently using drugs or in recovery, but he believes the New Year can offer renewed hope, too.
My closest friends are my friends in recovery, because we can talk to each other about what we feel today and help each other through it.
Many patients in recovery are concerned about taking antidepressants.
His own daughter is in recovery after five years of struggling with an eating disorder.
origin: Late Middle English (denoting a means of restoration): from Anglo-Norman French recoverie, from recovrer get back.
